parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the deviation category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Protocol Deviation
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DVCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the protocol deviation?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the deviation event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the DVCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DVSCAT can only be used if there is an DVCAT and it must be a subcategorization of DVCAT.
fields.label: Protocol Deviation Subcategory
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DVSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the protocol deviation?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVYN

fields.completionInstructions: Enter Yes if a protocol deviation occurred and No if none occurred. Ensure that any adverse event, concomitant medication use, newly discovered medical history, etc. which triggers a protocol deviation is noted in the respective CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not there were any protocol deviations.
fields.implementationNotes: EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system.
fields.label: Any Protocol Deviation
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: DVYN

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVDECOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record protocol deviations identified and/or select the appropriate code from the list of protocol deviation terms.
fields.definition: The sponsor defined standardized text for the name of the protocol deviation.
fields.implementationNotes: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a code list of responses, then DVDECOD should be used to store the code list response. Sponsors must use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF and in some cases, both may be used. For example, if the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free text descriptions of code list items, then DVTERM should be used to store the detailed descriptive text
fields.label: Deviation Dictionary-Derived/Standardized Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DVDECOD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVTERM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the appropriate code from the list of protocol deviation terms.
fields.definition: The reported or pre-specified name of the protocol deviation.
fields.implementationNotes: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a free text field, then DVTERM should be used to store the free text response. Sponsors may use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF, but a value in DVTERM is required in the SDTM-based datasets.
fields.label: Protocol Deviation Reported Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DVTERM
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation term?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date that the protocol deviation using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). This should be the start or occurrence of the protocol deviation and not the date it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The start date of deviation represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: This may be derived if not collected on a CRF.
fields.label: Deviation Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVSTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: If appropriate, record the start time (as complete as possible) of the protocol deviation in an unambiguous time format (e.g.,., hh:mm:ss). This should be the start or occurrence of the protocol deviation and not the time it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The start time of the deviation represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.label: End Time of Deviation
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation start time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the protocol deviation using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). This should be the date the protocol deviation stopped and not the date it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The end date of the deviation represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.label: Deviation End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: If appropriate, record the end time (as complete as possible) of the protocol deviation in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss). This should be the time the protocol deviation stopped and not the time it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The end time of the deviation represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.label: End Time of Deviation
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DV.DVSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Protocol Deviation Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: DVSPID
fields.questionText: What is the protocol deviation identifier?
